result.markdown:
--- title: "Stative verb ‘be’: periphrastic present" author: "Timur Maisak" date: 2025-08-28 format: html lang: ru css: styles.css --- Stative verbs can have a short form and a long form of the present tense. The long form is periphrastic and consists of the converbial form of the stative and the present-tense copula. Both the long form and the short form of the copula can occur in such periphrastic constructions (e.g. *a-ni jiʔi* vs. *a-ni i* ‘IN.be 1.COP’ in Kina). In some varieties, the long form is contracted, with the copula becoming suffixed to the stative verb (e.g. *a-na-w* ‘IN.be-3’ < **a-na w-i* ‘IN.be-CVB 3-COP’ in Shinaz). The maps below show the distribution of the long present tense forms. ## Gender 1 ::: {.panel-tabset} ### Карта ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
